image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

props.synopsis: Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom was one of seven people killed while working with the World Central Kitchen charity in central Gaza.

title.children: PM conveys 'anger and concern' to Netanyahu over strike that killed Australian aid worker

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM: Zomi Frankom's death 'is a significant loss for our nation'
Anthony Albanese concerned about 'social cohesion' in Australia
Australians are 'very concerned' about the 'extraordinary loss of life' in Gaza, PM says

image.altText: Aid worker Zomi Frankcom stands on the tarmac infront of a military airplane.

props.synopsis: Israel takes responsibility for a series of air strikes that killed several aid workers, including Australian "Zomi" Frankcom, in Gaza, as the country's PM Benjamin Netanyahu says "it happens in war".

title.children: Crews in Gaza took 'several hours' to recover bodies of aid workers, including Australian, after air strikes

image.altText: A man with brown hair and a moustache on the left and above ground at a mine with piles of dirt and machinery.

props.synopsis: Internal emails show an engineer asked the Ballarat Gold Mine management in May last year not to proceed with a handheld drilling trial without "minimum" ground supports "to ensure that we all get home to our families".

title.children: Ballarat Gold Mine warned over potential for fatal rock fall months before miner's death

image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: With the finish line in sight, the Federal Court has provided another twist in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten after the broadcaster yesterday won its bid to reopen the case and put fresh evidence before the court.

title.children: What does the reopening of Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case mean for a judgment?

image.altText: Gurjinder Singh with his arm around Dharmvir Singh.

props.synopsis: While a two-year-old girl was saved, the girl's father Dharmvir Singh, 38, and grandfather Gurjinder Singh, 65, got into trouble in the pool's deep end and couldn't be revived.

title.children: The tragic deaths of a father and son raise a question — why do adult men face a heightened risk of drowning?

image.altText: Mim Fox stands in a backyard garden slightly smiling

props.synopsis: Mim was denied credit from her bank because of her single status, but before that, she was ignored and "cut loose" when she asked for financial hardship help. She's not alone, with complaints about banks and lenders on the rise.

title.children: When Mim's mortgage went up by $1,200 a month she asked her bank for help and never heard back

image.altText: Former PM Tony Abbott, smirking, sits next to Peter Dutton, smiling, in a joint party room meeting

props.synopsis: While we assume that federal politics is often an argument between two major parties or competing philosophies, there is another undercurrent that exists within governments and is blowing up again right now, which is: Politicians vs Lawyers.

title.children: The wild scenes in an Abbott cabinet meeting that are still lingering a decade later

image.altText: A woman holds a very young baby.

props.synopsis: In this coastal region south of Adelaide, teachers are among parents who remain unsure when they can return to the workforce as the waiting time for a childcare place balloons to two years.

title.children: Fleurieu Peninsula parents unsure when they can return to work amid two-year wait for childcare

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large deep blue lake surrounded by a ring road and adjoining farm properties.

props.synopsis: The bright blue waters of Mount Gambier's biggest attraction draw in plenty of visitors, but there are not many opportunities for businesses to take advantage of the tourists wanting to see the volcanic crater.

title.children: Cellar door opens next to Blue Lake, but council's 'activation' plan still in the works

image.altText: Smoke rising from Gaza after intense bombing.

props.synopsis: The US has in recent days reportedly green-lit the transfer of billions of dollars' worth of bombs to Israel, including warplanes and 900-kilogram bombs that have been blamed for mass civilian casualties.

title.children: Warplanes and 900-kilogram bombs that 'pancake buildings' among new weapons US reportedly sending Israel

image.altText: A man sitting, with a suit on, looking on

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin is being humiliated in the Black Sea, where a third of Russia's naval fleet has been destroyed by Ukraine's attacks. Some say a plan to move the surviving vessels into a new port could draw a third country directly into the war.

title.children: After humiliations in the Black Sea, Putin has a devilishly clever plan to put Ukraine in a tricky place

image.altText: Firefighters stand out the front of a recently burnt-out building

props.synopsis: Eight people have been detained after the fire broke out during daytime renovation work at a nightclub which is underneath a 16-storey residential building.

title.children: Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills at least 29 people as investigations into the blaze continue

image.altText: A police line running along the permiter of a land area with buildings and cars in the distance

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old child has been killed and two others seriously wounded in a shooting at a school in Finland, police said, with a fellow 12-year-old pupil suspected of the attack being taken into custody.

title.children: One child killed, two wounded in Finland school shooting, 12-year-old suspect in custody

image.altText: A t-shaped copper IUD in front of a dark background with a pink sold out tag attached.

props.synopsis: Australian women are struggling to get copper intra-uterine devices (IUDs), with suppliers and authorities at odds over whether there is a shortage.

title.children: Patients struggle to access non-hormonal contraception amid confusion about supply

image.altText: An image of the front of the Adelaide Magistrates Court building on Victoria Square

props.synopsis: Police allege Victorian man Matthew James Dullard struck Orroroo Brevet Sergeant Mark Woods during a traffic stop on the Barrier Highway near Ucolta on Friday.

title.children: Man charged with attempted murder of SA police officer stopped taking medication for diagnosed schizophrenia, court hears

image.altText: A "give way" sign at an intersection on a country road.

props.synopsis: A 51-year-old man facing several charges over a crash at Penola, SA that killed two people has been granted bail and is expected to face court again later this year.

title.children: SA man charged over fatal crash on Easter Sunday granted bail

image.altText: Wes Garrett stands with his arms crossed between two taller firefighters dressed in navy shirts.

props.synopsis: Aviation firefighters are planning to strike over staffing and safety concerns just as thousands of students around Australia are set to begin school holidays.

title.children: Airport firefighters' planned strike action could impact school holiday travel

image.altText: the Royal Adelaide Hospital sign on the front of the building with a tree in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Ambulance ramping at South Australia's public hospitals reached near-record levels last month, with the state government citing "extreme" pressure on the health system.

title.children: SA ambulance ramping hits near-record levels amid 'extreme' pressure on the system

image.altText: A composite image of a crocodile at Casuarina beach and Axle the dog.

props.synopsis: The owner of a fetch-obsessed dog says she will reconsider walking along a popular Darwin beach after her pet was set upon by a 2-metre crocodile.

title.children: 'Axle, get out!' Top End blue heeler escapes jaws of 2m saltwater crocodile

image.altText: Two boys look at a phone and another looks away and laugh

props.synopsis: The NT police commissioner says a dangerous game is being played by young people in Alice Springs who post, then boast, about their crimes on social media. Experts say it's a nationwide issue.

title.children: 'We feel angry': Alice Springs teens frustrated by rise in social media crime

image.altText: an apartment block with a police vehicle out front

props.synopsis: After being called for a welfare check, police force their way into an inner-Brisbane unit and discover the body of a woman with stab wounds.

title.children: Brisbane man charged with murdering his mother after body found with stab wounds

image.altText: Bandt, in a puffy jacket, stands on the street behind a "Vote Yes" sign, handing out flyers.

props.synopsis: The Greens appear not to have made any major financial contribution to the Voice referendum campaign, according to figures released by the AEC on Tuesday, despite a withering internal battle that led to a senator quitting the party over her opposition.

title.children: Greens did not donate or spend money on Voice referendum campaign captured by AEC disclosures

image.altText: A graphic composite image of an illicit nicotine vape, the scales of justice and piles of cash

props.synopsis: There have been just 12 successful convictions for selling illegal nicotine vapes in NSW in 18 months. NSW Health Minister Ryan Park says the government will invest $4.3 million over three years in compliance and enforcement to stop illegal sales of the product.

title.children: Australia is trying to end vape sales, but experts say there's 'no economic incentive' for sellers to stop

image.altText: A generic photo of ASX board.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is set to fall further from its near-record high, following significant losses on Wall Street over doubts about the timing of the Federal Reserve's upcoming interest rate cut. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to drop from record high, Wall St sinks on doubts about timing of US interest rate cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gold hits new record, Wall Street drops, oil jumps to five-month high
Major banks are preparing for the possibility of Armaguard's collapse
'The super-rich continue to thrive': Forbes publishes list of 2,781 billionaires

image.altText: Shoppers, some wearing face masks, walk past a sign that says Myer Stocktake Sale.

props.synopsis: An explosion of previously-inaccessible data is transforming the way the ABS goes about its job and is set to make statistics that used to be only fairly reliable suddenly very reliable.

title.children: From where we work to what we spend, the ABS knows more about us than ever before: here's what's changing

image.altText: Drag queen standing in front of a tinsel curtain and jeans artwork

props.synopsis: In 1994, artist Matthew Cook curated the first LGBTQIA+ Blak art exhibition at Boomalli. Thirty years later, the annual Mardi Gras exhibition is still breaking ground.

title.children: The Lookin' Good art exhibition was about celebrating Queer Blak art in 1994. It also had a serious side

image.altText: architectural plan of a house with an indoor rainforest near its front

props.synopsis: Indoor rainforests, pop up concrete barriers and rooftop flood refuges are just some of the design solutions being adopted by developers returning to the flood plains of northern NSW.

title.children: How does growing a rainforest inside a building make it flood-proof?

image.altText: A flat white

props.synopsis: This is the little-known story of how Italian sugar growers in the Sunshine State are said to have inspired the "invention" of the flat white — a drink that would go on to become a global sensation.

title.children: It's now loved all over the world, but who really invented the flat white?

image.altText: Swirling water that appears sandy brown.

props.synopsis: Swimmers are being told to avoid Victoria's bay after a significant weather event that saw 11 records broken across the state.

title.children: 'Fairly rare' weather event leaves Victorian bay unsuitable for swimming

image.altText: Andrew Tate on private jet

props.synopsis: High school teacher Grace thought she'd landed her dream job. But she quit after one term when male students who were fans of self-described misogynist Andrew Tate made her feel unsafe.

title.children: Teachers are quitting due to Andrew Tate's ideology driving sexual harassment and misogyny in class

image.altText: Hannah Conda wears a blue dress with cape-like sleeves, staring into the camera with a determined look, pout and hand on hip.

props.synopsis: Competing against the globe's finest queens, Hannah Conda made the top two of RuPaul's Drag Race UK vs the World. She hopes it changes how people view our drag scene.

title.children: From the priesthood to the heights of international Drag Race: Hannah Conda's rapid rise to the top

image.altText: Jace Reh looks.

props.synopsis: Gay conversion practices have been outlawed across much of the country, most recently in New South Wales — but not in South Australia. Jace Reh is one of several survivors involved in an SA group that is pushing for a ban.

title.children: Advocates call for end to 'harmful' gay conversion practices in South Australia

image.altText: Man and woman, married couple, stand in their garden in front of a steel frame garden feature.

props.synopsis: These television towers, and their quirky histories, live on in some towns in the Mid North and Yorke Peninsula in South Australia despite the analogue signal ending in Australia in 2013.

title.children: Old TV towers now a unique garden feature

image.altText: An elderly man with glasses sitting at a table lifting a fork with food to his mouth

props.synopsis: The family of missing 80-year-old Peter Roach says his Queensland hospital failed to keep him safe, as right to information documents show supervisors were not always informed when he left his ward.

title.children: Dementia patient escaped from hospital several times before disappearance, documents reveal

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: Terms like negative gearing and capital gains tax sound complicated but you shouldn't be put off by the financial jargon. You don't need to be a money expert to understand what they mean.

title.children: What is negative gearing? Why is it so controversial?
